page.content: Ellon has rapidly become a major {commuter town}for{Aberdeen}over the past ten years. This expansion is a result of the discovery of oil in the North Sea. The population has been rising since this discovery and has now reached 9000, quite a difference to the 1550 people who inhabited the small original market in the 1960's. To accommodate the large population many new housing estates have been built on all four sides of the original town eg.{Meiklemill and {Craighall}both on the south side of the{River Ythan.}In the past 5 years one more estate has been built, {Castlepark}situated to the east of the town. Many residents of Ellon have lived here all their lives but there are those who have 'moved in' not just from the British Isles but from abroad.Most of the residents are young
